title: HPI Spencer
content: Patient reports ongoing achiness in her wrist with limited motion, which remains stable and does not limit her activities. She experiences electric sensations on the ulnar and dorsal aspects of her hand when using her hands frequently. She inquired about the results of her nerve studies.
instruction: Summarize the History of Present Illness (HPI) as a coherent paragraph in clinical note style. Include only the patient’s history: onset, duration, location, severity, mechanism of injury, treatments received, and progression of symptoms. Do not include exam findings, imaging results, or any objective measurements. Maintain chronological order and use full sentences. Include information only if explicitly stated in the transcript. Do not add assumptions, inferred limitations, or negatives unless explicitly stated.

title: Plan
content: Continue gaining strength in the wrist. Recommend advanced activity as tolerated. Delete carpal tunnel diagnosis.
Review nerve study results. No evidence of carpal tunnel syndrome. Possible ulnar nerve compression at Guyon's canal, but the patient is not symptomatic in that distribution. Will watch this finding.
Recommend urology consult for evaluation of radiculopathy.
Patient approved for full duty starting 9-1-2025.
Return to clinic in 6 to 8 weeks for follow-up.
